quote: I'm hoping I don't have to remind    the admiral how many people pass    through here during a week's time.     It's not possible to keep tabs on    every single person while they're on    the station...
If I didn't know you better,    commander, I'd think you were just    making excuses...
I'm not making excuses!  Would it be    in keeping with Federation policy to    frisk everyone who steps through our    airlocks?  To search every room of    every visitor during their stay?
Of course not... but with two    kidnappings and a ship being    destroyed... all in less than a    week's time... obviously your security    measures leave something to be    desired...
Security on this station is by the    book.  Our security program and the    officers who work in it are first-    rate.

Then what were they doing when all    this was happening?  We here at    Starfleet are watching how you resolve    this situation very closely,    commander.  We think it might be    prudent to replace this chief of    security you have...
Odo is both highly intelligent and    extremely thorough.  He's the most    qualified person I have for the job.
Still, it would be a concrete example    that you are taking active measures    to resolve this situation... and to    make sure it doesn't happen again.
I stand behind my chief of security    one hundred percent.
That may be a mistake, Commander...
Then it's my mistake.

Then let me make my point again.     Starfleet is very unhappy this has    happened.  We want this matter taken    care of immediately.  I don't have    to remind you how this reflects on    your position...
We're doing everything we can to    apprehend the kidnappers...
Don't bother me with details.  Just    clean up the mess, Commander.  And    quickly.  Before this becomes a    permanent stain on your record.     Do I make myself clear?
Yes, sir.
The Cardassian freighter Bok'Nor    is requesting permission to depart    Upper Pylon One in three minutes...
We've got an incoming Bolian vessel    at coordinates one-zero-one mark    three-eight... give the Bok'Nor a    clear trajectory out of the traffic    pattern...
Acknowledged.
Feel like getting together for dinner    tonight?
Can't.  I'm having dinner with Captain    Boday.
The Gallamite?  You're going out on    a date with him?
Is something wrong with that?
(it's no skin off her     nose)   No... not at all...
He happens to be brilliant.  His    brain is twice the size of yours and    mine.
I know...       I've seen it.
It's not his fault Gallamites have    transparent skulls...
No, it's not.  But it's not exactly    the view I want to have with dinner.
You know, Kira, sometimes I think    you place too much emphasis on how    men look.
What's that supposed to mean?
Nothing.
Look -- when I kiss a man goodnight,    I like to know where I'm kissing    him.
I guess seven lifetimes gives me a    somewhat broader perspective...
Since I have just one lifetime, I    have to be a little more particular    about whom I go out with...
I never said I wasn't particular...
I'm not the one who dates Ferengis.
What's that supposed to mean?
Nothing.
Releasing docking clamps at Upper    Pylon One.
That's funny... I'm picking up    elevated...
Deep Space Nine to Bok'Nor... shut    down your engines... repeat shut    down your...
Report!
Some kind of impulse overload...    checking...
Ops to all engineering personnel...    report to rescue stations... we have    an S-I-D in progress...
There's nothing left of it... there's    no one left to rescue...
Kelindide... rhodinium... nothing    unusual there... all materials    commonly used in Cardassian ship    construction...
Maybe it was a malfunction in the    impulse generator...
I'd like to be able to tell you that,    Major... but it's just too soon to    be sure...
I can't believe the Cardassians have    waited this long for an official    explanation...
Anything, Chief?
No sign of an explosive device yet,    sir...
I've got every Admiral within subspace    range on my butt... can I at least    tell them it looks like an    accident... ?
Well, I wouldn't do that quite yet,    sir...
When.
I'll let you know.
Anything from the Cardassians yet,    Commander?
Not a word.
All Bajoran outposts have been put    on alert for retaliatory strikes.    The provisional government has made    a statement disavowing any    responsibility.
Maybe it really was an accident.  I    mean, it is possible.
An "accident" involving a Cardassian    ship in Bajoran space... if I were a    Cardassian, I wouldn't easily    accept...
(overlapping, off     sensors)   Hmmm, that's odd...
What?
I'm picking up traces of a mercassium    compound.
Mercassium?  There shouldn't have    been any mercassium on board that    ship...
Well, there was...
Meaning... ?
I'm not sure yet.
Is mercassium some kind of explosive?
No, it's a synthetic composite used    in shield generator construction by    the Federation.  We don't share that    technology with anyone.
Chief, I don't think you're going to    find evidence of an explosive    device...
Lieutenant, respectfully, these kinds    of things take time and I've got    to...
I don't think you're going to find    an explosive device because I'm pretty    sure it was an implosive proto-matter    device... designed to match the    impulse signature...

Just before the explosion, I picked    up a sudden increase in their fusion    rate... I've been trying to find any    sign of a malfunction in the Bok'Nor's    engines to explain it... but there    just isn't one.  This doesn't look    like an accident... The fusion shock    had to be caused by something external    to the impulse drive system...
If a proto-matter device was attached    to the crossfeeds, it could have    created the overload... and we'd    never see any sign of it...
Can you prove that's what happened?
Maybe... if we could get a high    resolution spectra of the impulse    debris... but that's gonna take    some...
... time, yes, I know.  Get it started.     I'll tell the Admirals.  Sisko out.
Benjamin...
Hello, Cal, thanks for coming on    such short notice.
I wish it didn't take a disaster    like this to get us back together.
Hi, Calvin...
Jadzia Dax...
Dax!  My gosh... I can't believe...    boy, you look a lot better than the    last time I saw you.
Security Chief Odo... Lieutenant    Commander Calvin Hudson... Starfleet's    attache to the Federation colonies    in the new Demilitarized Zone...
You must be concerned about the    colonies' security at a time like    this...
Well, we haven't seen any unusual    deployment from the Cardassians along    the border...
Neither have we.  That's what's got    me worried.
Come on into my office.
I don't have time this trip.  But    we've got a few stories to catch up    on, Lieutenant.
Next time.
That woman knows more about me than    any woman has ever known... even    more than my wife did...
Tell me about it.
Don't you find it a little...    uncomfortable?
She's a good officer.
Yeah, but Curzon was...
She's not Curzon.
(beat, realizing maybe     they're involved)   You're not...    (uses his fingers to     connect the two of     them)
No.  She may not be Curzon.  But she    is Dax.
That would be extremely... strange...
So, how's Jake?
As tall as me.
No.
And he throws inside to back his old    man off the plate.
A little chin music, huh?
He's growing up too fast.
It must've been tough for you.  At    least I didn't have a kid to raise    by myself.
Well, we kind of helped each other    through it.
When I heard about Gretchen, I wanted    to be there for you.  There was just    no way to get back...
I know that.       I was hoping when they sent me to    the colonies that we'd be getting in    some more R&R time together...
Who's got R&R time?
You can't imagine what my life's    been like since the Federation    abandoned these colonies...
Abandoned them?  Doesn't your presence    there...
My presence there is a joke.  I'm    supposed to help these colonies    function under the terms of the new    treaty -- what the hell does that    mean?
I thought these colonists wanted to    stay... that they refused to be    evacuated.

(shrugs, what else     could they do?)   The treaty gave away their territory    to the Cardassians... territory these    people had invested their lives in...    if you knew them like I do, Ben,    you'd understand why they couldn't    leave.  It's a bad treaty.  The    Federation gave away too much.
Several Cardassian colonies wanted    to stay on the Federation side of    the Zone too... it seemed like a    reasonable compromise...
The Cardassians were delighted to    keep their colonies in our territory.     Because they knew we'd protect them.     But they're not about to do the same    for ours.
A number of Admirals at Starfleet    Command are worried the destruction
(a critical grin,     shakes his head)   Are they really?
As the two ranking officers along    the Cardassian border, we've been    asked to assess the potential risk...

There is no risk, Ben.  None.  I've    been dealing with the Cardassians    for most of my professional life.     Believe me, the Cardassians are very    happy with what they got out of this    treaty.  They're not going to risk    losing all they've gained by sending    forces into the Zone.  They're much    too slick for that.  If I were you,    I'd be more concerned about security    along the Bajoran border...
(considers that a     beat)   Are you surprised that they haven't    responded at all yet?
You know as well as I do they never    let you see what you expect to see.     They'll respond.

(typically, matter-of-    factly Vulcan)   Quarters have been arranged through    discreet channels... Deck Seven,    Section Four-"G"... I suggest you    keep a low profile until your ship    arrives...
What can I get you?
You are Quark, aren't you...
I assure you the warrant is out of    date.  I cleared that matter up months    ago...
Warrant?
Oh.  When you recognized me, I    assumed...
You are counting your receipts.  It    is logical to conclude that you are    the proprietor of the establishment.
You're... very observant.  What can    I do for you?
I was hoping to discuss a business    proposition.
With me?  Uh, perhaps I should    explain about that slip-of-the-   tongue....
Your past is of no consequence to    me.
I'm... delighted to hear you say    that.  Because nothing would please    me more than to make a fresh start    with the Vulcans, Ms... ?
Sakonna.
Sakonna.  Such a handsome name...    for such a handsome young woman...
What'll you have to drink... wait a    minute, I have just the thing...
Vulcan port.  Three centuries old.     Very rare.  Very expensive.  Shall I    pour you a glass... ?
No.
Not even a taste?  It's exquisite...
I'm not thirsty.  Thus I see no reason    to have a drink.
Well... it'll be right here... should    you develop a thirst.  Now -- you    mentioned a business proposition?
It is a private matter.  I'd rather    not discuss it here.
Then we can discuss it over dinner...    that is we can plan the business    meeting to coincide with when you    think you might get hungry.
That would be acceptable.
That would be wonderful!  How does    eight sound to your tummy?
I will return then.
And by the way, I'd love to melt    that cold Vulcan heart of yours.
Jake?
Your son is not here, Commander...
Dukat... ?
Sorry.  I didn't mean to startle    you.
(coldly, fearing the     worst)   Where is he.
Your son?  How should I know?       You... you believe that I... really,    Commander... do you think I would    ever harm your son?
I think you're capable of anything.
You wound me.  I'm here as your    friend.
Sisko to Kira...
Please do not act hastily, Commander.     We must talk privately.
Yes, Commander?
Major, I want you to find Jake.
Is he missing?
I don't know.  Find out where he is    and let me know.
Understood.
How the hell did you get in here.
I was an unregistered passenger on a    Kotakian ship that docked here this    morning.  I slipped in through the    cargo bay...
And made your way here?  Without    anyone seeing you... ?

I was the commander of this station    for almost ten years.  When one knows    the various corridors and passageways    as well as I do... by the way, I    love what you've done with these    quarters...
Kira to Sisko.  Jake's fine,    Commander.  He's with Nog watching    the women coming off the Bajoran    transport at Docking Bay One... shall    I have him brought to your quarters?
No, that's all right.  Thank-you,    Major.  Sisko out.
There you are.  Safe and sound.
What are you doing here?
You have a problem.
Do I?
The Bok'Nor.
Is this the Cardassian Central    Command's way of responding to my    communiques?
On the contrary -- Central Command    has no idea I'm here.    (off Sisko's skeptical     reaction)   It's true.  I'm here unofficially...    to help you find the truth about the    Bok'Nor...
Why would you want to help me...
Because I already know the truth.
You know who's responsible?
That's right.
Who...

You are.       Oh, not you personally, Commander...    I know you're an honorable man.     You're not one to sneak around and    attach implosion devices to impulse    engines... but, believe it or not,    some of your brethren are willing to    do such things -- morally superior    human beings and other members of    the Federation...
I'm supposed to take your word for    that.

Of course not.  It's my job to    convince you.  So you can clean your    own house... instead of forcing us    to do it for you... which would    certainly endanger the new treaty...       We'll need one of your runabouts...
Where are "we" going?
The Volan Colonies.
The Demilitarized Zone?
Not so demilitarized, I'm afraid...
I notice my controls are not    illuminated.  Isn't it customary for    both seats to be turned on?  So that    I may pilot the craft in the event    of an emergency?
If there's an emergency, I guess    you're out of luck.
Commander, I'm not going to sit here    and steal all your little technical    secrets, I promise you...
I appreciate your assurances.  But    Cardassians are famous for their    photographic memories...
Ah, so you turn off my controls so I    won't have enough "light" to take my    photograph, is that it?
I've heard they put Cardassian    children in intense mind training    programs when they're four years    old, is that true?
The Cardassian educational system is    unparalleled in the quadrant...
If you don't mind taking the joy out    of growing up...
Education is power... joy is    vulnerability...
Your reaction surprises me, Commander.     I thought you would understand.  Of    all the humans I've met, you strike    me as the most joyless and the least    vulnerable.
I am when I'm with you.
Well said.  But in truth, I was    looking forward to getting to know    you better on this journey.
I think we know each other well    enough.
Is that a ramscoop control or a    deflector grid panel... ?
Just curious.       It really doesn't matter.  Cardassian    pursuit vessels are years ahead of    this design.
What is it?
Long range sensors are picking up a    distress signal...
From whom?
A Federation merchant vessel...       ... under attack by Cardassians.
Two attack vessels.  Just inside the    Demilitarized Zone.
That's not possible.  I promise you,    Commander, we would not violate the    treaty.

The merchant ship's com-links have    gone down.  I can't raise them...    computer, fix source coordinates of    the distress signal and lay in a new    course... warp three...       I hope you don't mind.
I'm as curious as you are.
What type of Cardassian ship are    they?  Patrol cruisers?
No.  Much smaller.  They look like    shuttlecraft...
Cardassian shuttles?  Attacking a    Federation merchant ship?
They seem to be armed with Galor-   class phaser banks...
They must be from the Cardassian    colonies in the Demilitarized Zone...       Hail them.
No response.
Open a channel.
Go ahead.
(addressing Cardassian     ships)   To the pilots of the Cardassian attack    vessels.  This is Gul Dukat, Commander    of the Second order.  Please respond.
This is Gul Dukat, security    identification A-D-L-Four-Zero.  I    order you to immediately disengage    your attack.
We're still two minutes away... the    Federation vessel's shields are down    to forty percent.
Hail the Cardassians again.

I don't know who you are or where    you're from... but you're going to    pay for this, I promise you... answer    me immediately... or I will personally    fire the photons that will destroy    you...
I'm serious.  Arm your photons.
The photon launcher is...
I know.  I knew all about your    controls before I came aboard.  Tell    me when we're in torpedo range.
Stand by... I'm picking up another    ship moving toward them...
That's a Federation signature, I    believe, Commander...
It sure isn't from Starfleet... I've    never seen a ship configuration like    that before... it almost seems like    someone modified an old support    courier.       Hailing them...
No response.
They've fired torpedoes... what kind    of civilian vessel that size would    be carrying a photon...
Something from one of your colonies,    perhaps?
Do you begin to see, Commander, that    without any help from either of us,    they've managed to start their own    little war out here...
I hope you're hungry.  I've planned    a wonderful meal for us...
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: ... starting with plomeek soup, which    I know is a traditional Vulcan    favorite... followed by Jumbo Romulan    mollusks... you can't get those back    on Vulcan anymore, can you...
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Do you eat in this grand a manner    every night?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Certainly not.  This is a special    occasion.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: It is?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: The commencement of a new business    relationship is the most special    occasion for any Ferengi.  It's a    cause for opening great bottles of    wine, dancing into the wee small    hours of the morning...    (to the waiter, re:     wine)   We'll let it breathe for a few    minutes.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Very well, I will attempt to respect    some of your cultural idiosyncrasies.     I will drink the wine.  But I won't    dance.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Maybe you'll change your mind after    you drink the wine.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: No.  I won't.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Come on.  Somewhere inside that cool,    controlled exterior of yours, there's    a wild woman screaming to get out...    Maybe by the end of the night, you'll    be dancing on the tabletops...    (off her even     expression)   Maybe not.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Is it appropriate to begin our    business discussion now?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Rule of Acquisition number two-   fourteen: "Never begin a negotiation    on an empty stomach."
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Rule of Acquisition?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Yes, yes... every Ferengi business    transaction is governed by two hundred    eighty-five Rules of Acquisition...    to insure a fair and honest deal for    all parties concerned... well, most    of them anyway...
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Commendable.  To create a code of    behavior for business transactions    is...
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: ... it's logical...
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: ... and quite reassuring.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Do the Vulcans have anything similar?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: In structure, it reminds one of the    Vulcan Bill of Rights which guarantees    the fundamental personal freedoms of    every Vulcan citizen...
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Same thing exactly.  May I propose a    toast?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Is this another cultural idiosyncrasy?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Yes.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: You know I can't describe the honor    I feel at this moment... it's rare    that a Ferengi and a Vulcan can    overcome their inherent differences    to see eye-to-eye as we're doing...    I've always had the greatest respect    for Vulcans... even though the few    I've met haven't exactly felt the    same way about me.  You are a noble    people and I salute you.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Now then, what kind of business    proposition do you have in mind?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: I wish to procure weapons.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: I beg your pardon?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: Guns, phaser banks, photon torpedoes,    troop transports and a number of    cobalt-thorium devices... my list is    quite extensive.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: You're a gun runner?
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: I'm prepared to pay in latinum and I    will very likely need a continuous    supply for the foreseeable future.
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: You're... you're not like other    Vulcans, are you...
scene: 30   INT. QUARK'S SECOND FLOOR - A SEMI-PRIVATE TABLE

quote: The Federation merchant ship refused    to be boarded!
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: So, your ships just decided to open    fire...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: It was clear the Federation ship was    carrying weapons through the    Demilitarized Zone...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: That ship was carrying medical    supplies to Soltok Four...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Ben, what are you doing here?
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I'm not sure yet.  Gul Dukat asked    me to accompany him.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Dukat.  No one informed us that you    were coming.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I decided an impromptu visit would    be preferable... so you wouldn't be    bothered with special preparations...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I see.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Commander Sisko, do you know my    counterpart in the colonies, Gul    Evek?
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I'm glad you're here to listen to    this, Commander.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: We monitored the attack on our way    in...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Yes, "monitor" is the proper word    because none of the ships would    respond to our hails... the Cardassian    pilots even refused to acknowledge    me.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: A strange voice from a Federation    runabout...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I gave them my security    identification.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Well, obviously they had their hands    full...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: With an unprovoked attack.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: "Unprovoked," was it?  Do you deny    that the Federation is engaging in    organized terrorist activities against    the Cardassian people?  Deliberately    attempting to undermine this treaty?
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: The Federation does not conduct secret    wars.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Perhaps, then you can explain where    the Federation ship came from, the    one that was outfitted with photon    torpedoes... ?
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: How about explaining why your ships    were armed with Galor-class phaser    banks?
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: They have the right to defend    themselves against these organized    terrorist activities.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I haven't heard any proof yet of    "organized terrorist activities"...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Because there is none.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: On the contrary, we have the    confession of the Federation terrorist    responsible for the destruction of    the Bok'Nor at your station,    Commander...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Confession?
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: A forty-three-year-old male human,    William Patrick Samuels, born Bergan,    Norway, Earth...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: We know who he is... what have you    done with him...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: (continuing, ignoring     the question)   ... came to the Federation colony on    Volan Two twenty years ago... married,    wife's name Louise, two female    children aged fourteen and twelve.     He was quite cooperative once we    apprehended him from Deep Space    Nine...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: My name is William Samuels.  I am    being held for crimes against the    Cardassian people.  I have been well    treated.  I have confessed that, as    a member of a well-armed anti-   Cardassian force organized by    Federation colonists, I set an    implosion device that destroyed the    freighter Bok'Nor.  I deeply regret    participating in this arbitrary attack    that led to the deaths of over seventy-   five crewmen.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: To my wife and children, I'm sorry    and I love you.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: We'll want to talk to him ourselves.     You'll make him available, of    course...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Bring him in.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: He would have confessed to anything    after you were through with him...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: On the contrary, he confessed quite    early in the interrogation    procedure... far sooner than we    expected.  I believe he truly felt    remorse.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Unfortunately, he committed suicide    in his cell.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: (to Dukat, re:     Cardassians)   Get them out of here.
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: We'll talk later...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: ... We can't let them get away with    this...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: ... We'll talk later... go on now...
scene: 33   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I knew him... Bill Samuels was a    farmer... he cultivated his land for    twenty years... raised two kids on    that land... he made something out    of that land... and the Federation    told him he had to give it all to    the Cardassians... well, he wasn't    willing to do it...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: (arguing the Federation     position)   And it was people like him who made    both sides realize that some    accommodation had to be made for    these colonies... so they could    stay...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: The Cardassians have no intention of    letting these people stay, Ben...    they'll drive them out or kill them...    it's already started... not a day    goes by without some random act of    violence against our people.  Every    Federation colonist knows you never    go out alone at night... can you    imagine living in that kind of    fear... ?
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: If you're saying the Cardassian    authorities are not enforcing the    laws, we can...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Enforcing the laws?  The Cardassian    "authorities" were part of a mob    that stoned two of our colonists on    the streets of Ropal City three days    ago...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: That's something the Federation can    take up with the Cardassians at the    highest levels...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: (shakes his head,     sarcastic)   I'm sure that'll help.  The word is    the Cardassian High Command is arming    their colonists to the teeth...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: You really think they'd risk sending    weapons into the Demilitarized Zone    and breaking the treaty...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I think they'd find a way to do it    that wouldn't be so obvious...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Not long ago, we caught the    Cardassians shipping weapons to    Bajoran extremists through a third    party -- the Yridians...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: That sounds about right.       Could the Bok'Nor have been    transferring weapons to someone else    to bring in here?
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: If it was, the transfer was made    before the ship reached the station...    the cargo holds of the Bok'Nor were    empty...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: You think he did it?
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Samuels?       I don't know.  They could have forced    him to make a false confession and    then killed him.
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I don't think Dukat would drag me    all the way here unless he knew he    could prove this...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Then, maybe Bill did do it, I don't    know.       Damn... I gotta go see his wife...    what am I gonna tell her...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Makes you kind of pine for the dull    old days at New Berlin, huh... sausage    and beer all around, when everyone's    idea of a good time was the Mazurka    Festival...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Jennifer and Gretchen had a ball    together there, didn't they...
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I'll never forget the sight of you    in those lederhosen.
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: I still have the hat.
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: Is there something larger going on    here, Cal... are these colonists    organizing some kind of terrorist    campaign?
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: They sure as hell aren't going to    tell me about it if they are.       But I'll tell you something just    between us, Ben, these people have a    right to defend themselves.  Once    the Federation said good-bye to them,    they were left with no other choice.
scene: 37   INT. VOLAN COLONY MEETING HOUSE - DAY

quote: You're very quiet, Commander.
You knew about Samuels before we    left...
I knew about his confession yes.  I    didn't know he was... I was as    surprised by his death as you were...
No one's going to buy your suicide    story.
I don't care what he did... this    kind of barbaric disregard for life    will gut this treaty...
If it means anything, I entirely    agree.  I told Evek that he was a    fool to let Samuels die.
That's all you're interested in,    isn't it.  The "advantage."

Now, don't go spouting off your holier-   than-thou Federation fair-play    dogma... I apologized, didn't I?     And lest we forget, your man was    responsible for the deaths of seventy-   eight innocent crewman.
What was the Bok'Nor transporting?
The Bok'Nor had delivered fourteen    metric tones of Golside ore to the    Regulon system prior to its arrival    at the wormhole...
You're sure it wasn't carrying    weapons...
Weapons?  To whom?
To the Cardassians in the    Demilitarized Zone...
The route of the Bok'Nor didn't take    it anywhere near the Demilitarized    Zone.
It could have rendezvoused with    someone else... with the Lissepians,    maybe... transferred the weapons to    them... and they could have taken    the weapons to...

Commander, I know you'd love to find    a justification for this mass murder    to ease your Federation conscience.     But if the Bok'Nor had been carrying    weapons, I would know... and on the    lives of my children, I swear to    you, it was not.
I didn't know you had children.
Seven.
I received your message.  How soon    will it be available...
My source can have everything ready    tomorrow... say, by fourteen hundred    hours...
That's not soon enough.  I must leave    the station tonight.
You're leaving so soon... ?
My plans have changed.  Can your    source have the materials ready by    tonight?
I guess he'll have to.
I have your latinum.  If you'd like    to count it...
Are you trustworthy?
I'm a Vulcan.
Of course.  It was just a little    joke.  I'm sure that it's all...    well, it wouldn't hurt to give it a    quick count, I suppose...
I'll have it brought to your quarters.
I was... looking forward to showing    you more ways to mix business with    pleasure...
Perhaps in the future.  I find you...    intriguing, Quark.
"Intriguing."
You can stay in the guest suite on    Level H-Two while you arrange for    transport back to Cardassia.  I'll    have a security guard sent to meet    you there.
Starfleet security, if you don't    mind, Commander.  Some of the Bajoran    deputies were around in the good old    days when I was in charge.
I understand.
If there's anything else I can do to    assist you in your investigation...
I think I can handle it from here.
Chief... ?
Yessir... I've got answers for you...    but I'm not sure you're gonna like    them...
It was an implosive device...
Yessir and not only that...
Not only that, it was a Federation    implosive device.
(reacts at Sisko's     foreknowledge)   Yessir.  The traces of mercassium we    found were from the casing of the    device itself.  It had to be a    Federation design.
Get me Starfleet Command on subspace.
Commander, is there... anything you    want me to communicate to the    Provisional Government?
You can tell them some reckless    Federation colonists in the    Demilitarized Zone blew up the    Bok'Nor... there's no further threat    of Cardassian reprisals to Bajor...
I'll advise all of our outposts to    stand down...
Sir, are you, are we... facing the    prospect of war here?
Not if I can help it.
Is that what the colonists are after?
I'm not sure they know what they're    after, Major.  I just know they have    to be stopped.  And it's Starfleet's    job to stop them.
Sir, I know this is none of my    business...
... but you're going to give me your    opinion anyway...
I don't know what the Cardassians    told you but...
They played a confession from the    man who planted the bomb... a man    they very likely tortured to death...
And you don't think you might be    playing into their hands... ?
I've got people out there killing    people, Major... you suggest I turn    a blind eye to that?
Don't they have a right to defend    themselves...
... they've crossed the line...
... if Starfleet is unwilling to defend    them in the neutral zone...
... they chose to live with the    Cardassians...

Well, I didn't.       But I lived with them for twenty-six    years before liberation came.  Every    Bajoran lived with them... in constant    fear.  I know what those colonists    are going through.  Most of all I    know the Cardassians can't be trusted    to keep their side of the bargain in    this treaty...
So, you'd suggest the Federation    shouldn't keep our side of the bargain    either... perhaps by arming these    colonists...

I can't answer that, Commander.  But    I can tell you one thing for certain --    the Cardassians are the enemy, not    your own colonists.  And if Starfleet    doesn't understand that, then the    Federation is more naive than I    already think it is.
I've been sent to relieve you...
There must be some mistake.  I just    reported for duty an hour...
Yes?
(pretending he's now     Dukat's guard)   Sorry to disturb you, sir, but there's    a message here from Commander Sisko...
We've been asked to escort you to    Airlock Eleven, sir.
Is there a problem?
A Cardassian freighter has just    arrived.  Apparently another bomb    has been found and disarmed.
Where's Commander Sisko?
Comfortably asleep in his quarters,    I hope.
Remember me?
I take it we're not about to board a    Cardassian freighter...
What do you think they're telling    him...
(dry, worried for     Sisko)   With two kidnappings and a ship    exploding in the course of a week,    I'm sure they've got a few things to    say...
It's their own fault... I've been    warning them from the beginning...
What are you talking about, their    fault... you're in charge of    Security...

You let me be in charge of Security    and I'll give you a safe station.     You people tell me to do my job and    then give me a Federation rulebook    on all the things I can't do.  Untie    my hands before you start to blame    me, Mister O'Brien...
I'm sure no one meant to blame you,    Odo...
(ignoring her, full     of steam)   Give me the right to set a curfew,    let me do more searches of arriving    passengers, give me fifty more    deputies...
And this station will be just like    it was during the occupation...
Say what you will, it was safer then.
Unless you happened to be a Bajoran.
I want a complete review of all    security measures on board this    station.
I'd be delighted to accommodate you.
What do we have from the guard?
He's given us descriptions of the    two who assaulted him -- a Vulcan    female and a human male in a Starfleet    officer's uniform...
We're trying to locate anyone they    might have contacted here...
How many ships left the station during    the night?
Only two, sir:  a Bardeezan merchant    ship... and a Galador freighter ...
What were their destinations?
The Bardeezans went through the    wormhole.  The freighter is operating    on a trade route between Galador Two    and Farius Prime.

I'm guessing these people wouldn't    take Dukat through the wormhole...    they'd head back to the Demilitarized    Zone with him.  Dax, check the Galador    ship's registry and make sure it's    in order.  Chief, see if you can    identify its warp signature from our    sensor records...
No problem, Commander... I've got    it...
Last known course?
The computer's showing it was on a    bearing of two-one-six, mark one-   seven-seven... as it went out of our    sensor range, it was still headed    for Farius Prime...
Major, send a message to Farius    Prime... if that ship shows up, and    I doubt it will, I want to know about    it right away.
I can send out the warp signature    over subspace.
Make it a general transmission.  If    they did change course, someone might    spot them...
Do it.
It's a phony.
The Galadorans don't have any ships    in this sector... the registry is    forged...

Doctor, Major, you're with me...    Odo, send a message to Commander    Hudson at the Volan Colony that I'm    moving in his direction on the    assumption that Dukat will be taken    to the Demilitarized Zone... give    him the warp signature of the ship...

Commander, we've just received a    general subspace transmission from    somewhere in the Demilitarized Zone.     A group there is taking credit for    the kidnapping of Dukat.  They're    calling themselves... the Maquis.
Commander, a Klingon freighter two    light years from the Demilitarized    Zone has I.D.'ed the warp signature...    the ship did change course just as    you predicted...
Transmit their last known coordinates    and heading to us, Chief...
Acknowledged.
Let us know if anyone else picks up    their signature.
Aye, sir.  O'Brien out.
Set a new course, Major.
Yes, sir.       Their heading would take them into    the Badlands...
Badlands?
A stretch along the Cardassian border    that ships try to stay away from...    a lot of plasma storms in the area...
A couple of ships have been lost    there over the past year or two...
Sounds like the perfect place for a    hideout...       Excuse me, sir -- but what do you    plan to do if we catch up with them?     After all, these Maquis are Federation    colonists...
We're going to get Gul Dukat back by    any means necessary.
Even if we have to fire on our own    people...
Long range sensors are picking up    the warp signature... it leads to an    M-class asteroid...
Take us there.
Scanning the surface... I've located    the ship...
Those are human life signs...
Is there a Cardassian among them?
No, sir...
Prepare to beam down...
I'm glad to see you didn't have too    much trouble finding us, Ben...
It seems that one disaster after    another keeps bringing us back    together again.
